ygData.messageBody:
That is a brilliant idea, and I honestly love it. Those messages should be
in group say, not plain say imo.

Verant will probably never do it. They rightly feel that building the trust
amongst players is important. You have to get to know others well enough to
group with them and trust them to tell you what loot is, which necessitates
long-term grouping relationships, which is a positive thing. If you put
these messages in then you diminish the necessary trust relationships
between players and somewhat diminish to need for long-term relationships.

But Verant continually surprises me both positively and negatively.

[45 Bard] Crier (Half Elf) <Seekers of Norrath> ZONE: work

> From: Peck White <peck_white@...>
>
> There was a thread I read earlier but I'm not sure it
> was on this list. The jist of the thread was, to
> prevent disputes about loot, when a corpse is looted
> you would see the following:
>
> PlayerX loots MobY's corpse
> PlayerX sees a Black Pearl
> PlayerX sees a Fine Steel Long Sword
> PlayerX recieves 3pp 2gp 8sp 2cp
>
> This doesn't seem like it would be too hard to code
> and would eliminate any dispute, assuming the person
> doing the questioning was present at the time of the
> looting.
>
> Tomerrilin
> Mith Marr
